messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: I will derive this data from the following paragraph: CASE NAME: The Puzzling Park Predicament DATE: 10/10/81 The courtroom was a domain of detailed interrogation as the trial proceeded. The prosecution beckoned the officers central to the investigation to elaborate on their findings. LAW ENFORCEMENT TESTIMONY: PROSECUTOR: Please state your name and role in the investigation. WITNESS: I am Lieutenant A. B. Baker, the chief investigator in this case. PROSECUTOR: Thank you, Lieutenant Baker. Can you elucidate on the events on the afternoon the predicament was discovered? WITNESS: Certainly. On the afternoon of February 2nd, Officer C. D. Davis identified an abnormal situation in the park and reported it. The investigation commenced forthwith. PROSECUTOR: Who directed the forensic examination? WITNESS: Sergeant E. F. Fisher and Technician G. H. Harrison oversaw the forensic analysis. PROSECUTOR: Who managed the interrogations? WITNESS: Detectives I. J. Jackson and K. L. King conducted the interrogations of suspects and potential witnesses. PROSECUTOR: Thank you. No further questions. The Defense commenced an extensive cross-examination of Lieutenant Baker regarding the investigative methodologies. Throughout the trial, Patrol Officer M. N. Nelson, Patrol Officer O. P. Peterson, and Patrol Officer Q. R. Reynolds were also brought to testify.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Lieutenant A. B. Baker 
Officer Context: Lieutenant Baker is the chief investigator in the Puzzling Park Predicament case, elucidating on the events on the afternoon the predicament was discovered during the trial. 
Officer Role: Lieutenant 

Officer Name: Officer C. D. Davis 
Officer Context: Officer Davis identified an abnormal situation in the park on the afternoon of February 2nd, which initiated the investigation. 
Officer Role: Officer 

Officer Name: Sergeant E. F. Fisher 
Officer Context: Sergeant Fisher, alongside Technician G. H. Harrison, directed the forensic examination related to the case. 
Officer Role: Sergeant 

Officer Name: Technician G. H. Harrison 
Officer Context: Technician Harrison worked with Sergeant E. F. Fisher on the forensic analysis concerning the abnormal situation in the park. 
Officer Role: Technician 

Officer Name: Detective I. J. Jackson 
Officer Context: Detective Jackson, alongside Detective K. L. King, managed the interrogations of suspects and potential witnesses to gather more information regarding the predicament. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Detective K. L. King 
Officer Context: Detective King, along with Detective I. J. Jackson, was tasked with conducting the interrogations to collect additional information about the incident. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer M. N. Nelson 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Nelson was summoned to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer O. P. Peterson 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Peterson was also called to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer Q. R. Reynolds 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Reynolds was brought to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer
